edu.uchsc.ccp.testing
Interface TestContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
LoveHateTester, ParserTestContext
public interface TestContext

A TestContext sets up and then tears down the context needed to run a customized user test suite. Instances of TestContext classes are created automatically by the testing framework when needed.

When a test is run, it is passed the test context specified for the test suite as an parameter.

Author:
R. James Firby

Method Summary
 boolean initialize(TestSuite suite, java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> errors)
          Initialize this test context for the test suite passed in.
 boolean terminate(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> errors)
          Tear down any state that needs to be unwound before this context is abandoned.
 

Method Detail

initialize

boolean initialize(TestSuite suite,
                   java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> errors)
Initialize this test context for the test suite passed in. If there are errors during initialization, add them to the errors collection passed in.

This method is called by a TestSuite before the test in the suite are run.

The TestSuite passed in as a parameter can be used to access initialization values included in the XML definition of the suite.

Parameters:
suite - The test suite that is requesting this context.
errors - Errors added to this collection will be mentioned in the test suite output.
Returns:
True if initialization succeeds, false if the context cannot be used for tests.

terminate

boolean terminate(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> errors)
Tear down any state that needs to be unwound before this context is abandoned.

Parameters:
errors - Errors added to this collection will be mentioned in the test suite output.
Returns:
False if the state cannot be unwound successfully.
